page.title: 04Farming in Northill
page.content: This edge of the{East Beds. market {garden area}presents a neat and tidy appearance. Fairly large areas of barley, wheat, rape, potatoes, sugar beet and sprouts are grown. Field grown market garden crops include lettuce, cabbage, marrows, courgettes, onions, radish, broad and green beans, spinach and parsley. Small areas are used for the growing of rose trees. Hedgerows are mechanically trimmed. Many farmers burn most of the straw, an act which is not always popular. There are several farm reservoirs used in irrigation. The traditionally large labour force is being replaced by more machinery, larger tractors and the use of precision drilling, crop spraying and mechanical harvesting. Farm livestock consists mainly of calf rearing. The few meadows are usually grazed by riding ponies.
